title: Electron in a uniform magnetic field

content.question: The figure shows a uniform magnetic field, <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>B</mi></math>, directed into the page. At the instant shown, an electron of mass <math alttext="m sub e" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mtext>e</mtext></msub></math> is moving with velocity <math alttext="v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi></math> perpendicular to the field, toward the top of the page. As a result of this motion, the electron moves in a circular path. Which of the following gives an expression for the radius of the path and the direction of circular motion?

choices.label: The radius is <math alttext="the fraction with numerator m sub e, end sub, times v, and denominator e B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>m</mi><mtext>e</mtext></msub><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>e</mi><mi>B</mi></mrow></mfrac></mstyle></math> and the direction is clockwise.

The radius is <math alttext="the fraction with numerator m sub e, end sub, times v, and denominator e B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>m</mi><mtext>e</mtext></msub><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>e</mi><mi>B</mi></mrow></mfrac></mstyle></math> and the direction is counterclockwise.

The radius is <math alttext="the fraction with numerator m sub e, end sub, times v squared, and denominator e B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>m</mi><mtext>e</mtext></msub><msup><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow><mrow><mi>e</mi><mi>B</mi></mrow></mfrac></mstyle></math> and the direction is clockwise.

The radius is <math alttext="the fraction with numerator m sub e, end sub, times v squared, and denominator e B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>m</mi><mtext>e</mtext></msub><msup><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow><mrow><mi>e</mi><mi>B</mi></mrow></mfrac></mstyle></math> and the direction is counterclockwise.

The radius is <math alttext="the fraction with numerator e B, and denominator m sub e, end sub, times v, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mi>e</mi><mi>B</mi></mrow><mrow><msub><mi>m</mi><mtext>e</mtext></msub><mi>v</mi></mrow></mfrac></mstyle></math> and the direction is counterclockwise.

content.answer: The radius is <math alttext="the fraction with numerator m sub e, end sub, times v, and denominator e B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>m</mi><mtext>e</mtext></msub><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>e</mi><mi>B</mi></mrow></mfrac></mstyle></math> and the direction is clockwise.
